title: A Study of the reasons and the results of Pecola's Sufferings in Toni Morrison's the bluest eye
abstract: In this thesis, the thesis writer chooses Toni Morrison The bluest eye. The novel tells us about Pecola?s suffering through out her life. Therefore, in this thesis, the thesis writer is eager to know the reasons and the results of Pecola?s suffering. She uses the theory of characterization and the theory of conflict to analyze the reasons and the results of Pecola?s suffering. She finds out that her suffering is due to her physical problems: her being ugly, black, and poor, and her physiological problem: her being unloved. All those problems cause her into insanity.
subjects: AMERICAN FICTION-20TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; MORRISON, TONI, 1931-... THE BLUEST EYE-STUDY AND TEACHING
